intro: Oldenlandia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale blue flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in cymes. Oldenlandia parviflora is known for its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments, often found in forests or along stream banks.
